node.statement: (Identification of the renormalized exponent) Write the full exponent Psi_eps(phi) = Psi_eps^{ren}(phi) + L_eps(phi) + K_eps, separating: (i) the renormalized part Psi_eps^{ren}(phi) = 4 lambda integral psi_eps :phi_eps^3: dx - 6 lambda integral psi_eps^2 :phi_eps^2: dx + 4 lambda <psi_eps^3, phi_eps> + <(-Delta+m^2)psi, phi>, which converges as eps -> 0 to a well-defined random variable Psi^{ren}(phi) under mu; (ii) the divergent linear part L_eps(phi) = 2 delta_m_eps^2 <psi_eps, phi_eps> arising from mass renormalization; (iii) constants K_eps. The normalized RN derivative R_eps = exp(Psi_eps) satisfies E_{mu_eps}[R_eps] = 1, which constrains the constants and absorbs the divergent contributions.
